str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Third. Ordinal from treis; third; neuter a third part, or a third time, thirdly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
In like manner, likewise, just so. From hos and an adverb from autos; as thus, i.e. In the same way.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From kata and leipo; to leave down, i.e. Behind; by implication, to abandon, have remaining.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
